programme.title: Super Senses 2: Special Forces S1 - "NAVY SEALS"
programme.desc: In the water, it takes sophisticated navigation systems, fine-tuned reflexes, and high-precision detection methods to survive. These animals have what it takes.

programme.title: Ocean Vet S1 - "Humpback Whale"
programme.desc: Watch Neil and his team swim with these ocean giants in a mesmerising and magical sequence as Neil comes face to face with one of the most intelligent mammals in the ocean.

programme.title: Ocean Vet S1 - "Sargasso Sea"
programme.desc: Follow the team as they collect samples for an exhibit that will educate local school children on the unique species and tiny life that lives within these golden rainforests of the ocean.

programme.title: Saving the Mustang - America's Horse on the Brink
programme.desc: Saving The Mustang explores the state of wild horses today through the efforts of three individuals. All stories interweave a compelling tale of perseverance and determination.

programme.title: The Rhino Orphanage S1 - "Nyani"
programme.desc: Little Nyani was born premature and was sent to the rhino orphanage. Raising a premature calf is a first for the orphanage. One day the little one is running around, the next she’s in Onderstepoort’s Veterinary Hospital, fighting for her life.

programme.title: Chameleons Of The World S1 - "Chameleons Of The World"
programme.desc: Discover the life of chameleons as they’ve never been seen before. It’s a journey of discovery into the forests of Madagascar, the savannahs of east and southern Africa and the Namib desert.

programme.title: Bright Now S1 - "Rebirth of an Underwater Forest"
programme.desc: Kelp forests harbor a higher diversity of plants and animals than almost any other ocean community. But, what happens when this ecosystem is out of balance?

programme.title: Oddly Satisfying Science S1 - "Water, Water Everywhere"
programme.desc: In this week's experiments we discover how water can start a fire, transform breakfast cereal into a magnetic field detector, and even change the way you visualize the world around you.

programme.title: Oddly Satisfying Science S1 - "Magnificent Mixtures"
programme.desc: In this week's experiments we mix up some fireworks made from tin foil, whip up a stinky polymer, and try out an alchemy staple - turning lead into gold.

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Tricks S1 - "South Korea - Youth"
programme.desc: This time Magical Bones is in Seoul. He goes to the B-Boy championships and also visits his friend Ji and performs a spectacular trick on a shirt.

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Tricks S1 - "Delhi"
programme.desc: In this episode Pete take to the streets of India’s capital city Delhi. He performs a series of fun and baffling tricks including a levitation attempt.

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Tricks S1 - "Delhi & Mumbai"
programme.desc: Pete is in Delhi and Mumbai performing magic to a variety of people, including a baffling thirst quenching trick, as well as making rings and himself vanish!

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Tricks S1 - "Manchester"
programme.desc: Pete Heat checks out some of the trendiest bars in the Mumbai, meets a famous Bollywood artist and shows you how to perform your own piece of magic at home.

programme.title: Power & S2 - "Rainer Farraq"
programme.desc: Rainer Farraq is an Austrian engineer who invented the TrixyFormer: An electric driven, enclosed motorcycle, which can be docked into many different vehicles.

programme.title: Power & S2 - "Chris Hoffmann"
programme.desc: When Engineer Chris Hoffmann’s daughter asked if it was possible to build a one-wheeled motorcycle she saw in a video game, he decided he probably could.

programme.title: Power & S2 - "Jean Yves Blondeau"
programme.desc: Jean Yves Blondeau is the inventor of the 32-wheel roller suit, the wearer who can ride downhill in a variety of positions at speeds of up to 112 km/h.

programme.title: Power & S2 - "Dennis Hong"
programme.desc: Dennis Hong is the director of Robotics Mechanics Laboratory at UCLA and has invented numerous new robots earning the nickname the Leonardo da Vinci of Robots.

programme.title: Ancient Engineering S1 - "Secrets Of Notre Dame"
programme.desc: Building for God reached a high point in the Middle Ages when a new engineering movement emerged in Europe, changing the rules forever.

programme.title: Ancient Engineering S1 - "Secrets Of Angkor Wat"
programme.desc: Temples, designed to honor the Gods, have been at the heart of cities since the earliest times

programme.title: Ancient Engineering S1 - "The Power Of Water"
programme.desc: Without water, civilization is simply not possible. Romans took control of their water supplies very, very seriously.

programme.title: Ancient Engineering S1 - "History’s Greatest Ships"
programme.desc: As far back as the Bronze Age, humans were building ships capable of crossing oceans and trading between continents.

programme.title: Secrets of the Brain S2 - "Plasticity"
programme.desc: Dr Jack meets a man who has defied all odds by miraculously recovering from severe brain damage, after a car crash left him lying in a coma for three months.

programme.title: Secrets of the Brain S2 - "Hypnosis"
programme.desc: In this episode we explore the science of persuasion and discover that even a hardened sceptic can be convinced – Dr Jack himself included.

programme.title: Secrets of the Brain S2 - "Genius"
programme.desc: In this episode, Dr Jack Lewis investigates the neuroscience behind genius. He meets a genuine genius, Sabrina Chevannes, a woman with an IQ of 178 at just 4.

programme.title: Secrets of the Brain S2 - "Cyborg"
programme.desc: Dr Jack meets David Rose who uses a new technology that doesn’t work with his paralysed body – it actually taps directly into his mind.

programme.title: Ultimate Processes S1 - "Waterford"
programme.desc: Francesca finds out how the world famous Waterford crystal is made and gets to try out glass blowing and glass cutting with surprising results.

programme.title: Ultimate Processes S1 - "Helicopters"
programme.desc: In this episode of Ultimate Processes, we investigate how the AW 101, one of the world’s most advanced search and rescue helicopters is designed and built.

programme.title: Ultimate Processes S1 - "Boats"
programme.desc: Presenter Francesca Chiorando visits an Italian company called Wally making some of the best looking and technologically advanced super yachts in the world.

programme.title: Ultimate Processes S1 - "Bikes"
programme.desc: We are in the middle of a cycling revolution and these days there’s a bike for every occasion, so presenter Francesca Chiorando tries out two of them.

programme.title: Hollywood Weapons: Fact or Fiction? S3 - "Larry's Shadow"
programme.desc: Larry gets sucked into Terry’s dark and mysterious world because Terry wants to test 2 scenes from the 1994 film with Alec Baldwin, The Shadow. Terry will find out if they can save a man trapped in cement shoes, and then they will do a seemly impossible test.

programme.title: Hollywood Weapons: Fact or Fiction? S3 - "We Hear Ya!"
programme.desc: Larry and Terry test several requests from viewers. They will test a bunch of crazy scenes from Bad Boys 2, Under Siege, A LIcense to Kill, and Bangkok Dangerous.

programme.title: Hollywood Weapons: Fact or Fiction? S3 - "D-Day By Air"
programme.desc: Terry goes back to paratrooper school and will see how difficult it was for soldiers engaging the enemy while parachuting down to safety on D-Day. He will attempt with 3 different weapons to hit several targets while descending from the air.

programme.title: Hollywood Weapons: Fact or Fiction? S3 - "Saving Private Terry"
programme.desc: Terry gets to relive part of his military carrier by attempting the famous sniper shot from Saving Private Ryan, and Larry and Terry demonstrate how sniper technology has developed over the years and test some amazing sniper shots.

programme.title: Xploration DIY Sci S5 - "Science Fair"
programme.desc: Steve Spangler’s sidekick Higginsworth panics when he has to deliver a science fair project.

programme.title: Xploration DIY Sci S5 - "Museum Of Science, Boston #2"
programme.desc: Host Steve Spangler and his sidekick Higginsworth return to the Museum of Science, Boston, where they take simple demonstrations they’ve done on DIY Sci and make them gigantic!

programme.title: Xploration DIY Sci S5 - "Inclusion"
programme.desc: For first time in his career as an educator, host Steve Spangler is invited to teach a class of kids who are blind or visually impaired.
